revised_title: Determining the Heliocentric Longitude of Saturn's Descending Node
tldr: The author, Thomas Bugge, observed the culmination of Saturn using a 6-feet achromatic transit-instrument and calculated its heliocentric longitude. By comparing the observed geocentric longitude of Saturn with the tables of Dr. Halley and M. de la Land, Bugge determined the error in the place of the node and provided a method to improve the accuracy of such calculations. This research contributed to a better understanding of planetary orbits and the precision of astronomical instruments.
